docs.snippet: Three highly disparate exhibitions of sculpture aspiring to be architecture, of photography attempting to bring us a sense of religious community and of some chic design ideas desperately hoping to be mistaken for mystical illumination opened...
docs.lead_paragraph: Three highly disparate exhibitions of sculpture aspiring to be architecture, of photography attempting to bring us a sense of religious community and of some chic design ideas desperately hoping to be mistaken for mystical illumination opened yesterday at the Jewish Museum, Fifth Avenue at 92d Street.

docs.snippet: Govt approves 21.5% wage increase, effective Dec 1; sets minimum wage at 15,000 pesos ($60) a mo; Natl Labor Fed, which has been demanding increases of up to 42.3%, charges raise is inadequate

headline.main: Uruguay Approves Rise In Both Wages and Prices

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Nov, 28 Although a military Government controls Argentina and an elective democracy prevails in neighboring Uruguay, the press in Argentina has become relatively free in recent months while the Uruguayan press is rigidly controlled.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Nov, 28 Although a military Government controls Argentina and an elective democracy prevails in neighboring Uruguay, the press in Argentina has become relatively free in recent months while the Uruguayan press is rigidly controlled.
docs.abstract: Article sees irony in relative press freedom permitted by Argentine mil rulers and strict censorship invoked by neighboring Uruguay, nominally an elective democracy; recalls nations long close ties, noting Uruguay was once Argentine province

headline.main: ARGENTINA EASES CONTROL OF PRESS; But Neighboring Uruguay Has Stern Censorship

docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 2 A senior Rumanian diplomat and his wife have requested political asylum in France, official sources disclosed today. The diplomat is Victor Dimitriu, who was Ambassador in Paris from 1964 to 1968.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 2 A senior Rumanian diplomat and his wife have requested political asylum in France, official sources disclosed today. The diplomat is Victor Dimitriu, who was Ambassador in Paris from 1964 to 1968.
docs.abstract: Former Rumanian Amb to France V Dimitriu and his wife request pol asylum in France

docs.snippet: The world will rejoice with the family of James R. Cross at his release, evidently in good health and spirits, after being held 59 days by Quebec Liberation Front terrorists. Mr. Cross, a British trade official, was one of those innocent victims of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The world will rejoice with the family of James R. Cross at his release, evidently in good health and spirits, after being held 59 days by Quebec Liberation Front terrorists. Mr. Cross, a British trade official, was one of those innocent victims of circumstance, used as a ploy by desperate men bent on subverting governments under the bogus banner of "liberation."
docs.abstract: ed on Cross release restates dilemma in pol kidnappings; notes govts are still far from devising effective ways to cope with them

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 1-- Politics is warming up in Uruguay and Argentina, and military officers, Government officials and journalists on both sides of the Rio de la Plata are sharpening their sabers for an expected spate of duels.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 1-- Politics is warming up in Uruguay and Argentina, and military officers, Government officials and journalists on both sides of the Rio de la Plata are sharpening their sabers for an expected spate of duels.
docs.abstract: Approach of elections and campaigning seen ushering in spate of duels since many Uruguayans and Argentines still prefer traditional duels to libel suits as way of settling pol disputes; even RC Ch in Argentina gives tacit approval; illus

headline.main: Duel Still Plays Role in Latin Politics
